poem:
### Grazing

The sheep wander, unknowing architects,  
seeds of green nipped in gentle jaws.  
They leave behind, not fields, but tinder,  
landscapes primed for the unfurling flame.  
Their clipped pastures speak softly  
of places that might have shadowed them—  
forests never risen, dreams of rain  
snuffed by their innocent, grazing intent.
